result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick E. Bass

records.addlTxt:
1:59 PM Defendant Patrick E. Bass in court, in custody.  22CF76 and 22CF77. Attorney Michael Yang in court for Patrick E. Bass.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Counsel inform the Court that the parties have a plea agreement but are not in agreement on the sentencing recommendation; Def wishes to enter his pleas today; State is asking for PSI; Defense will be asking for bond modification if sentencing does not occur today. Per the agreement, Def is pleading to all three charges in 22CF77; agreement calls for 22CF76 to be dismissed. 

In 22CF77, Court review pleas questionnaire/waiver with the Def. Def pleads guilty to the three counts in 22CF77. Finding of guilty. 

Atty. Yang - Defense argues for sentencing to allow for treatment court. DA Harper - State argues for PSI prior to sentencing. Court orders PSI. Sentencing set for 10/12 at 2 p.m. PSI due 10/5. Defense may also request an alternate PSI from SPD. If they do, Court orders that PSI to be due 10/5 as well.

Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm. - 22CF77

22CF76 DRI by the Court.
Sentencing hearing on October 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
From Treatment Court Coordinator; Determination of Eligibility

3:02 PM 22CF76/22CF77 -Defendant Patrick E. Bass appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael Yang appeared by video for Patrick E. Bass.  Attorney Yang has received the information and waives the formal reading. Max penalties stated. Attorney Yang stands mute on all charges for his client. Court advices the clerk to enter a NG plea. Attorney Yang asks for another status. Court sets theses cases on the trial calendar. PB has applied for drug court. Attorney Harper states that this will be a jointer and ask for two day for trial. Attorney Yang speaks about the jointer case.
Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Final status/scheduling conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury selection scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on December 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury selection on December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on November 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on August 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

to appear by zoom

Request granted.

10:24 AM 10:23 AM 22CF76/22CF77 - Defendant Patrick E. Bass in court, in custody.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael Yang in court for Patrick E. Bass. PB has received the criminal complaint. Attorney Yang waives the formal reading. Max penalties stated. Attorney Yang waives the preliminary hearing. 

Attorney Yang speaks about bond modification in 22CF77 and request a $200 cash bond. Attorney Harper object to the bond modification in 22CF77. Court denies bond modification.
Arraignment scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Harper appears for the state by video. Attorney Wynes appears for the defendant by video. State request $1,000 signature bond. No objection for defense. Court orders $1,000 signature bond.
